result.execSummary:
The defendant Tremell Lc Hinton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tremell Lc Hinton in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Tremell Lc Hinton in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by all parties.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 45 days time served.  
Court orders all costs assessments and surcharges to be paid as a condition of probation in 15CM361, failure to do so will result in civil judgment.   Appeal rights given.
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3:  Upon motion of the state, court orders counts dismissed and read in.
Court ordered case rescheduled to 8/17/2015 at 8:15 am.
Court ordered case rescheduled for 8/14/2015 at 8:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Court orders that $500 cash bail remain as previously set, bail will not be forfeited at this time.  
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO JusticePoint for supervision with the Pretrial Electronic Monitoring Program.  Drug testing, Breathalyzer tests, Absolute Sobriety, No drugs without a valid prescription, No Contact with the victim, release for employment.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Tremell Lc Hinton not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court on today's date and one additional case pending in Branch 4.
State's motion to join all cases for purposes of trial; granted by the Court.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court will allow GPS monitoring.  Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 4.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Status Update dated July 1, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Tiffany M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tremell Lc Hinton in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Tremell Lc Hinton in custody.  

Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
